results.purpose: Maps date inputs to corresponding month start and end dates for TPT SKU complexity calculations
key_data_points: Date range spans from September 2024 to December 2026
Each input date maps to full calendar month boundaries
Input dates vary throughout each month (not standardized to month-end)

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: SKU Complexity Calculator tool that requires date mapping functionality

entities.name: HelloFresh US
entities.context: Mentioned in email about 2025-W48 Recipe Report with menu scores and SKU launches

entities.name: Factor Canada
entities.context: Referenced in emails about menu loading issues and B2B Shopify integration

entities.name: Rachel LeMier
entities.context: Manager, Consumer & Product Insights - sent recipe report email

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Discussed context-driven product management and B2B Shopify integration

entities.name: Matthijs Muller
entities.context: Leaving HelloFresh after 10 years on December 19th

insights: The spreadsheet provides a lookup table for converting arbitrary date inputs into standardized monthly periods
Input dates are not consistently at month-end, suggesting they may represent reporting or processing dates
The tool appears designed to handle SKU complexity analysis over multi-year planning horizons
Date mapping is critical infrastructure for TPT (likely 'Third Party Tools' or similar) SKU management
The emails bundled with this spreadsheet suggest this is part of a larger HelloFresh operational system involving recipe planning, menu management, and product complexity tracking

results.purpose: Tracks open and planned engineering and product roles for EPD (Engineering, Product, Design) New Ventures division for 2026, including backfills and new positions
key_data_points: Mix of Live (2), Filled (2), and Pending (7) positions
Career steps range from CS4 (Mid Level) to CS7 (Associate Director)

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: Squad with 2 open backfill roles in Toronto for frontend developers (CS4 and CS6)

entities.name: The Pets Table (TPT)
entities.context: Product requiring Staff PM role (filled by Prateek Jajoo starting December)

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Major expansion with 5 roles (1 filled, 1 pending designer, 3 pending new engineering roles) funded by Good Chop P&L

entities.name: Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)
entities.context: Squad with 2 backfill roles (1 live CS4 BE, 1 pending CS5 BE)

entities.name: Tamir Arnesty
entities.context: Left Factor Form squad in October, CS4 FE backfill in progress

entities.name: Brian Leach
entities.context: Left Factor Form in August due to US RTO policy, CS6 Staff Engineer backfill ongoing

entities.name: Prateek Jajoo
entities.context: Filled Staff PM role for The Pets Table, starting December

entities.name: Chiamaka Glory Nwolisa
entities.context: Internal transfer from Growth Alliance filling CS5 FE role for Good Chop in December

entities.name: Yury Trofimov
entities.context: VP Good Chop, aligned on new engineering roles

entities.name: Dominik
entities.context: Verbally approved Good Chop new roles

entities.name: Marina Guthmann
entities.context: Exiting, Senior Product Designer backfill needed for Good Chop

insights: Good Chop is undergoing significant expansion with 5 roles (largest single initiative), transitioning to self-funded engineering via brand P&L
Factor Form squad experiencing retention challenges: 2 departures with difficult backfilling (rejected offers, hard-to-find candidates with web/Shopify/RN experience)
Geographic concentration: Canada roles in Toronto, German roles in Berlin, with some strategic location shifts (CS7 Canada role converted to CS5 DE role)
US RTO (Return to Office) policy cited as reason for at least one departure (Brian Leach)
Hiring challenges evident: roles open for months, contractor attempts failed, offer rejections at final stages
Internal mobility being leveraged: 2 roles filled via internal transfers with promotion potential
Timeline pressure: Multiple roles targeted for end of January 2026 due to backlog delivery needs
Most roles are replacements (8) vs net new (3), indicating focus on maintaining capacity rather than expansion
